markdownRemark.html:
I won’t pretend I was the biggest The Dillinger Escape Plan (TDEP) fan in the world. I have probably listened to roughly 80% of their discography. But I was enraptured by their unique style that sought to undo many of the comforts we have in conventional song-writing and musicianship.

Some years ago I was playing a video game called Bioshock in which you, the protagonist crash land in the middle of the ocean due to undisclosed causes. In this opening chapter you swim to a tower in the middle of the ocean, your only hope of surviving in the middle of nowhere. From here things get pretty crazy. The elevator takes you to an undersea city where the brightest scientific minds have created a safe haven for pushing the limits of what humanity can achieve.
